orangelight.title: Downcase what we get from cas
Electronic records need "online" badge and link in search results

comments.body:
Example: https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/catalog?utf8=%E2%9C%93&search_field=all_fields&q=99122438989606421

The record displays fine on the show page, but on the search results page, it needs an "Online" badge and a link.

![Screen Shot 2021-04-01 at 11 01 22 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/784196/113321868-a2b10200-92d9-11eb-82b2-a45951aacb1c.png)

I think #2387 does need to be implemented on the record page for this display corrected. Right now you only get the google books preview link on the record page. On the search results page we do this for the record now: The display text for the link comes from the 856 field in production and the links in Alma stored in 'electronic_portfolio_s' are structured differently so I'd probably use the title attribute value from 'electronic_portfolio_s' as the link text on both the results and the record page.

@kevin the ebook central link is showing. catalog-alma-qa was undergoing a reindex when this ticket was written. We were checking the show page from a local instance which had the latest indexing changes.
This record needed to get through a reindex. Show page looks right now.
The record was not displaying because we had not deployed the latest orangelight updates to the catalog-qa.

Block info needs to be added to the bibdata response so it can be pulled from the patron without an additional API call. Block data from alma looks like

```
      "user_block": [
        {
          "segment_type": "Internal",
          "block_type": {
            "value": "LOAN"
          },
          "block_description": {
            "value": "CONSORTIA"
          },
          "block_status": "string",
          "block_note": "string",
          "created_by": "string",
          "created_date": "2024-05-30T09:30:10Z",
          "expiry_date": "2019-12-18T14:36:48.659Z"
        }
      ],
```

How does this map onto our current values?

- patronGroupName
- blockCount
- blockReason

Here's some example block data from voyager:
```
            <myac:borrowingBlocks>
                <myac:title>Blocks</myac:title>
                <myac:clusterBorrowingBlocks>
                    <myac:cluster>
                        <myac:clusterName>Princeton University Library</myac:clusterName>
                        <myac:ubSiteId>1@PRINCETONDB20050302104001</myac:ubSiteId>
                    </myac:cluster>
                    <myac:borrowingBlock>
                        <myac:blockReason>odue_recall_limit_patron</myac:blockReason>
                        <myac:blockCount>1</myac:blockCount>
                        <myac:blockCode>21</myac:blockCode>
                        <myac:blockLimit>1</myac:blockLimit>
                        <myac:itemType xsi:nil="true" />
                        <myac:pendingHoldCount xsi:nil="true" />
                        <myac:patronGroupName>Faculty and Professional Staff</myac:patronGroupName>
                    </myac:borrowingBlock>
                </myac:clusterBorrowingBlocks>
            </myac:borrowingBlocks>
```

This issue is blocked pending a decision on whether to use alma's "library card" page instead of reimplementing this in blacklight.

Arguments in favor of using the alma page:

1. The local implementation requires 5 API calls to build the display page. Note that this is 1/5th of the concurrency limit for API calls.
2. There is functionality we cannot implement via the API, such as:
   1.  "renew all" (the api only provides single renewal, and again the concurrency limit) 
   2. up-front account limit notifications (e.g. "You can't renew this because you have too many fines" in the API is just "renewable: false")
3. There is functionality that will be time-consuming to re-develop and maintain locally, such that it starts to make more sense to use the existing page which already does everything we want.
   4. paginated /sortable loans list, fees, and requests. (note we'd probably need to do this in javascript)
3. Using the alma page would release developer time as we move toward go-live.
4. Penn went this route and advised us it's a good way to go.

There are a few considerations we need to iron out:
1. We'll need to do at least a little custom styling on this page, if only to get rid of the big vacation-y icons that display in the content areas when there's no data.
   2. documentation on how to do this: https://knowledge.exlibrisgroup.com/Alma/Product_Documentation/010Alma_Online_Help_(English)/070Alma-Summon_Integration/050Display_Configuration/020Branding_the_Services_Page 
   3. We will want a repo to put the CSS file/s in, with a little readme. We may use libapps for this with a directory called either "alma" or "summon"
1. Information Architecture for linking to the account page
   2. We can't customize the header any more than we've already done, so IA will likely depend on opening the library card in a new tab and trusting users to be able to get back to the catalog when they're done.
2. What do we do with guest accounts? Options:
   2. Get them netids (preferred)
   3. Provide them with usernames / passwords directly in Alma, managed by circulation
   4. Provide a minimal UI for them in blacklight 
   5. Just not provide an online account service for guests

Work for this issue is in progress on branch [2025-alma-account](https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/compare/2025-alma-account?expand=1) if/when we pick it up again.

pulfalight.title: Process all text with english fields.
Search for digital content not capturing everything with a dao

comments.body: Having a hard time finding one that's in PULFA but not Pulfalight so I can figure out why it's not returning.
Okay. I think the problem here is in description "Woodrow Wilson" is not matching "Woodrow Wilson's"

Here is another example that is not the 's issue
bernard baruch 
pulfalight looks like it is missing most of the results from the John Foster Dulles papers 

https://pulfa.princeton.edu/?v1=bernard%20baruch&f1=kw&b1=AND&v2=&f2=kw&b2=AND&v3=&f3=kw&year=before&ed=&ld=&rpp=10&start=0&has-digital-content=true
https://findingaids.princeton.edu/?f%5Bhas_direct_online_content_ssim%5D%5B%5D=online&group=true&q=bernard+baruch&search_field=all_fields
That one it looks like PULFA searches the full hierarchy for title matches, and Pulfalight doesn't.
That's definitely an issue if that's the case.
@faithc @ccleeton I created https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/issues/791, please prioritize it for me? I think you have one on deck slot left, after #789 is merged.

**Resolved:** OAR is back up in [`d4f0d68`](https://github.com/pulibrary/uptime/commit/d4f0d68b2d6304f703b37ef2beed169b6fb7816d
).
